alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alachua; Gilchrist; Southern Columbia; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 11:49AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Gilchrist, western Alachua and south central Columbia Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1149 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near High Springs to near Trenton to near Chiefland. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Alachua, High Springs, Archer, Newberry and La Crosse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Alachua; Gilchrist; Southern Columbia; Western Alachua
